newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Vienna shares add on, outlook friendly.
newsitem.headline: Vienna shares add on, outlook friendly.

text.p: Austrian shares end the week out on a firm note on Friday thanks to continued selective interest from investors, traders said.
"It was rather quiet ahead of the weekend. Individual issues drove the market higher," said one, adding there was also selective foreign interest although "not massive".
Traders see the market holding onto its firm tone next week as well, but that buying needs to fan out across-the-board in order to see further significant price gains.
The ATX index of 21 blue chips advanced 3.51 points, or 0.27 percent, to 1,290.7 points with 10 shares higher, 10 lower, and one unchanged.
Traders said the ATX was pushed off its high of 1,294.21 after profittaking kicked in around midday.
The ATX index faces a barrier on technical charts at 1,290 points, but should have no problem testing 1,320 points next week, the trader said.
Another trader said: "Underlying sentiment continues to be bullish. Every weaker day is seen as a buy day."
The leading ATX gainer was engineering group VA Tech, up 2.57 percent at 2,109.95 schillings while paper maker Leykam led losers, off 2.88 percent at 310.
The broad-based Vienna bourse index rose 1.15 points, or 0.24 percent, to 474.8 points.
The June ATX future added on 6.5 points at 1,291 on turnover of 804 contracts.
